results.title: First days
results.creator_credit: Slater Film Productions, Nicholas Cockram and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description: Looks at a school in South Australia where a policy of continuous admission is in operation. Shows the ways in which the parents and the new child are put at ease by the principal and class. Indicates the sorts of adjustments required from both the new student and the teachers. Also looks at vertical and small groups, open plan classrooms and parental involvement. Written by Terry Jennings.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Slater Film Productions, Nicholas Cockram and Ron Saunders

results.title: First day
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Patricia Edgar and Gordon Glenn
results.brief_description: The first day of school is a major step in the developmental process of children everywhere. This program follows 11 new starters from various religious, ethnic and socio-economic backgrounds on their first day of school. Tim, the child of a fourth generation farming family in the Mallee, Sarah from Melbourne’s Turkish community, Roland, only child going to school in Rose Bay, Sydney, twins Kate and Jessie, Isaac in Nimbin, Ashleigh from a new housing estate in Melbourne’s East, Matthew and Jessie, twins with special needs, Sam, heading to a one teacher school and Gurrupiya, a small school in North Eastern Arnhem Land. Parents, family and friends discuss how their children have been raised and how it has contributed to their eduction skills thus far. Features footage of children on their first day of school and the thoughts and emotions they are experiencing. Research co-ordinator: Annemarie O’Brien. Narrator: Gordon Glenn.

results.title: First contact
results.creator_credit: Arundel Productions, Bob Connolly, Robin Anderson and Dick Smith Adventure
results.brief_description: Documents the clash of two cultures that occurred in the 1930s when the people of the highlands of New Guinea encountered the first Europeans to enter their world. One of these Australians, Michael Leahy, took a movie camera with him.

constellations_other.name: Bob Connolly
constellations_other.description: Australian audiences just can't seem to get enough of exploring local governments, bureaucracy and politics, whether that's through documentaries or biting social satire.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Arundel Productions, Bob Connolly, Robin Anderson and Dick Smith Adventure
results.description: Documents the clash of two cultures that occurred in the 1930s when the people of the highlands of New Guinea encountered the first Europeans to enter their world - for an El Dorado. One of these Australians, Michael Leahy, took a movie camera with him, and so managed to capture on film the confrontation between one civilisation and the representatives of another.

results.title: First citizen: Albert Namatjira
results.creator_credit: Juniper Films, John Tristram and I. James Wilson
results.brief_description: First Citizen charts the life of aboriginal painter, Albert Namatjira. Born in 1902, Albert Namatjira rose to star status through the acceptance of his art by white Australia in the 1950s. As a result, he was awarded Australian citizenship in 1958. What followed was an often tragic life, caught between white Australian and Aboriginal cultures.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Juniper Films, John Tristram and I. James Wilson

results.title: First Christmas: the story of the first Christmas snow
results.brief_description: A puppet animated Christmas story about a boy who is blinded as a result of an accident and cared for by the members of the local convent. On Christmas Eve he regains his sight as the snowflakes fall on his face.

results.title: First break
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Silva Basmajian, Adrienne Amato and Derek Rogers
results.brief_description: The ongoing struggle of living with a diagnosed mental illness is portrayed in this program through candid interviews over one year with three teenagers, who are experiencing mental illness, and their families. Their personal stories, shared with great sensitivity and honesty, illuminate the challenges and dis-orientating effects of mental illness as well as its impact on their conception of their self-identities and their relationships with family and friends. As the camera follows the course of their lives over this period we are given an insight into their own hopes, strengths and achievements as well as their frustrations in dealing with their mental illness in every day life. “First Break” also questions the stigmatised view of mental illness through these very personal stories, providing a portrait of young people coping with their experiences and the powerful changes it has meant for their own as well as their families lives.

results.title: First born: the life and times of Jack Davis (A)
results.creator_credit: Zest Films, BBC Bookmark and Rene Roelofs
results.brief_description: A portrait of aboriginal spokesman, story writer and distinguished playwright, Jack Davis. Positioned as he is at the end of a long line of oral story tellers and at the beginning of a blossoming written tradition, Jack Davis is unique. Since 1979, he has devoted his life to writing and has been able to combine the rigours of writing with the ever insistent demands of family and aboriginal politics. In 1989 he was granted an artistic endowment award in recognition of his contribution to Australian arts.
results.title_for_label: First born: the life and times of Jack Davis (A)

results.title: First born = Premier-ne
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Susan Huycke, Colin Low and Joan Henson
results.brief_description: A film of poetic intent, set in Canada’s Pacific Rim National Park, where a woman giving birth, dreams of the growing infant. From the beauty of the images and the evocative music and sound effects, the viewers are impelled toward their own interpretation. Sound film without words.

results.title: First blood (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Orion Pictures Corporation, Buzz Feitshans and Ted Kotcheff
results.brief_description: His body and mind were brutally scarred from Vietnam. Then the small-town cop threatened him, abused and caged him like a wild animal - not like the hero he really was. They finally pushed him too far and all hell broke loose as he declared his own war against them. Rated: M Caption Version only Available.

results.title: First blood
results.creator_credit: Orion Pictures Corporation, Buzz Feitshans and Ted Kotcheff
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by David Morrell, “First Blood” began a trilogy of action films starring Sylvester Stallone as the tough but troubled Vietnam war veteran, John Rambo. Scarred from his horrific experiences in Vietnam, Rambo is abused by a power hungry “red-necked” sherriff in a small town who imprisons him. However, a caged Rambo is a dangerous beast and when he escapes the explosive action begins. Putting credibility aside, this is a prime example of the action movie genre which launched the careers of actors like Stallone, Schwarzenegger and Van Damme.
